page.title: 11N.FAREHAM:WICKHAM VILLAGE.
page.content: Although Wickham village centre is not in this block the southerly village outskirts are in this area.Wickham dates from the Saxon period and has a wide square bounded by an attractive variety of architecture built and modified over the centuries.It was granted a charter in 1268 for a market and fair and for one day each year the square is closed and the fair is still held.Present day Wickham is a large thriving village,with many amenities, including supermarkets,non food shops, three pubs,a school and and a church .There is a research vetinary hospital,the scene of recent controversy by Animal Rights activists and on the banks of the river Meon there is a sewerage works.
